segments.text: Good evening , Mr . Frank . Bourbon on the rocks ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No . This time I'll try Chinese wine .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What about Mao Tai , one of the most famous liquors in China ? It's good indeed . It never goes to the head .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do people here drink a lot of liquors ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Some do , some don't . Many people in the North are fond of liquors . I think it has something to do with the climate .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it has . Some Mexicans are crazy . They drink a lot of liquors even on hot days . Have you ever heard of " Tequila Sauta " ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , it's a very well-known kind of spirits in Mexico . People drink it with salt and lemon .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Right . It's very strong , just like alcohol . ( Frank sips Mao Tai . )
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , besides Mao Tai , we have Wu Liang Ye , Fen Jim and so on .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They say that Showing wine tastes quite good . What's it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It's rice wine , a kind of still wine , somewhat like Japanese Sake . Showing is a city in China .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: By the way , we also have some good red wine and white wine , such as Great Wall White Wine .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thank you for telling me so much , I'll try them next time .
segments.speaker: S2
